programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: The latest news, sport, business and weather from the BBC's Breakfast team.

programme.title: Morning Live S5
programme.desc: Conversation, advice and great company to make your morning.

programme.title: Rip Off Britain
programme.desc: Gloria Hunniford, Julia Somerville and Angela Rippon investigate an airport meet-and-greet company that ran up thousands of pounds of fines driving a man's car through central London, leaving him with the bill. And - all change! The last -minute switch of hotels that left holidaymakers dreams dashed. Simon Calder is on hand with his own inimitable guide to your holiday rights. Also, the Rip Off Britain advice clinic tackles travel insurance and helps one family owed a flight refund that's not been forthcoming.

programme.title: Fraud Squad S3 (1/10)
programme.desc: A council worker splurges £200,000 of public funds on horses and holidays.

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer S24 (44/60)
programme.desc: Featuring properties in Staffordshire, Rochdale and Hertfordshire.

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Join Christina Trevanion and experts Raj Bisram and Roo Irvine in Newark. Christina visits The National Holocaust Centre and is shown a moving collection of items donated by Holocaust survivors.

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international news from the BBC.

programme.title: The Repair Shop S2
programme.desc: Jay Blades and the team bring three treasured family heirlooms, and the memories they hold, back to life. Ceramics conservator Kirsten Ramsay takes on a very rare Royal Doulton figurine of a First World War soldier, once owned by the last master pottery thrower of the Doulton factory. Now the pride and joy of his grandson, the soldier has been through the wars - a fall several years ago knocked off his head. But before Kirsten can start her repair, she must undo a previous fix, allegedly done with glue made from egg white. Resident horologist Steven Fletcher and furniture restorer Will Kirk combine their skills to piece back together a small, long-case clock, which arrives with three sisters in three separate pieces. And silversmith Brenton West tackles a treasured magnifying glass, once used for picking winners from the papers.

programme.title: Money for Nothing S8 (9/15)
programme.desc: Jay Blades and the team upcycle two chairs, a sideboard and a drop-leaf table.

programme.title: Escape to the Country S23 (49/55)
programme.desc: Alistair Appleton helps a London couple find a new life and home in the countryside.

programme.title: Garden Rescue S8
programme.desc: Simon and Nancy would like the team to inject some of the glamour of Tinseltown into the unloved, neglected garden of their 400-year-old cottage. They have recently moved to the UK from Beverly Hills and are desperate for a nice spot to sit with some shade and privacy that reminds them of the home they left behind. Can Charlie and Chris bring their vision to life with £4K?

programme.title: Clean It, Fix It S2 (1/20)
programme.desc: The team visit Safiyah in Earl's Court.

programme.title: Pointless S29
programme.desc: The brainy quiz returns, but this time host Alexander Armstrong is joined by co-host Ria Lina. As always, contestants try to score as few points as possible by plumbing the depths of their general knowledge to come up with the answers no-one else could think of.

programme.title: Scam Interceptors S1 (7/10)
programme.desc: Rav Wilding is hunting down the scammers plaguing our lives.

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international news from the BBC.

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Anita Rani and Jermaine Jenas bring you the stories that matter from across the country.

programme.title: EastEnders (n°6705)
programme.desc: Billy lets his emotions get the better of him, leading to dire consequences.

programme.title: Chelsea Flower Show
programme.desc: Join Sophie Raworth and Joe Swift for an exclusive first look at the Royal Horticultural Society's Chelsea Flower Show 2023. They are joined by Adam Frost, Carol Klein, Rachel de Thame, Arit Anderson, Frances Tophill and Toby Buckland, who delve into some of the most eagerly anticipated show gardens and reveal this season's best blooms in the Great Pavilion.

programme.title: Steeltown Murders S1 (3/4)
programme.desc: The 1973 team clutch at straws, while in 2002 the killer is found through DNA technology.

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international news, with reports from BBC correspondents worldwide.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You S65
programme.desc: Steph McGovern is guest host with panellists broadcaster Carol Vorderman and comedian Nabil Abdulrashid joining team captains Paul Merton and Ian Hislop as they delve into the news.

programme.title: Radio 1's Big Weekend
programme.desc: The best moments from Radio 1's Big Weekend in Dundee.
